subject: Re: [junit] how to test abstract class
msgSnippet: This solution may not be ideal but it worked in my case. Inside my testcase I implemented a inner class that extends my abstract class and provides dummy
messageBody:
This solution may not be ideal but it worked in my case. Inside my testcase I implemented a inner class that extends my abstract class and provides dummy implementation for abastract method and then I used that class to test non-abstract methods. There might be better ways. I hope this helps.

regards,


>
> Hi:
> there is a question confuse me. I have a abstract class and it has
> some method which not abstract method.Now ,whether i must test it?
> how to test ? help me.
